item.title: How to Split a String in POSIX Shell
item.description: The POSIX Shell specification defines a minimalist shell language with few features compared to stalwarts like Bash. Yet POSIX shells are everywhere: Dash is the default on Ubuntu, and many Docker containers only have busybox ash. Minimalist shells use less resources and are faster than featureful shells like Bash and ZshÂ¹. They are more likely to be secure too, as the reduced feature sets are easier to reason about and provide a smaller attack surface for hackers.
